thread.title: What we learned: Seahawks escape Lions
thread.title_full: What we learned: Seahawks escape Lions

title: What we learned: Seahawks escape Lions
text:
What we learned: Seahawks escape Lions October 5, 2015 1 of 6 It's hard to play center in the NFL 
Seahawks center Drew Nowak had a night to forget, whether it was a few wayward snaps or the offensive line giving up six sacks. 
Nowak, in his first season as a starting center after playing defensive tackle at Western Michigan, shouldered the blame for the poor snaps. 
"I had a couple tough ones," he said. "That's on me. I need to do a better job and focus on that this week. That's not going to happen again." 
The Seahawks held a 13-3 lead about midway through the fourth quarter when Wilson was sacked by defensive tackle Ezekiel Ansah, fumbled and Lions defensive tackle Caruan Reid returned it 27 yards for a touchdown. 
"I think we definitely have a lot to work on," Nowak said. "Tonight was a good learning experience, I'll say it like that. We saw a lot of different things, a lot of different looks, movements, so I think it's important we go look at those things and then when we see them again, it won't be something new." Otto Greule Jr/Getty Images 1 of 6 It's hard to play center in the NFL
